body: I'm getting the same issue. It seems that I can override blocks entirely when extending from a template, but if I merely include the layout that contains the blocks I cannot find a single way to override, append, or prepend to them.

Glad it's not just me. I would love to use includes with inheritance; this is a pretty big issue for me. 

@visionmedia Is this issue tough to fix / known bug, or should we submit a pull request with some tests to illustrate it and possible fixes?
@rdrey a few simple tests would be great then ill have a look
Thanks. Will get on it tomorrow night. :)

I'm not sure if this is related but I am trying this which doesn't work:

A file with yield and blocks

```
section.panel
  block head
    header
      h1.title!= title
  .content
    yield
```

A file that includes the above, and tries to use the blocks

```
    include panels/panel
      block head
        h2 test
      img( src="#{work.urls.main}/poster_280.jpg" )
```

Using the blocks doesn't work.

issue.title: Test to show Issue #579

repository.name: pug
repository.description: Pug â€“ robust, elegant, feature rich template engine for Node.js

issue.body:
This test shows how blocks defined in includes are ignored by jade, i.e. issue #579

Simply `make test` to see the new test fail.

body: Took a little longer, didn't have time the last few nights. I'm hoping this test will make the debugging easier. Thanks TJ!

Anyone willing to check out the extra test to make sure my expected value is correct?

Then we can possibly get a BUG tag and get some of TJ's (@visionmedia) time ;) I might feel motivated to look for a fix myself, later this week.

ah I see. I'm not sure it really makes sense to both include and extend, plus implementation-wise the AST would have already been partially constructed for those block areas (until the `include` is reached), so it would require some backtracking and weird hacks

I would use it to selectively include javascript / css on my pages. For example the pricing page has some monster css that makes no sense anywhere else, so I extend the block stylesheets with an additional stylesheet link.

issue.title: Mixin hoist

repository.name: pug
repository.description: Pug â€“ robust, elegant, feature rich template engine for Node.js

issue.body: Make mixins work even if defined in extending or included files.
